questions.question: Explain edge computing in simple terms.
questions.output:
Edge computing is a way of processing data closer to where it is generated, instead of sending it all to a faraway data center or the cloud.

Think of it like this: Imagine you have a smart home device that watches for motion to turn on lights. Instead of sending every piece of video data to a distant server to decide if someone is moving, edge computing lets the device make that decision right there, on the spot.
